page.title: 01The N/E Approach to Beverley
page.content: The A1035 road from Hornsea and the East coast passes over flat, low lying land criss crossed by drains and dykes. The land rises very slightly in the northern part of this block where there is a small area of mixed woodland. The land is extensiely cultivated and used for arable farming and glass house crops. The road bisects the block from east to west, and bisecting the block from north to south are the Beverley and Barmston Drain ad the River Hull. A new section of the road now bypasses the main residential area of the block (Tickton). The river in the region of the new bridge, and the site of the old bridge (now a pedestrian bride only) is popular with anlers and boating enthusiasts. Since the village of Tickton was bypassed it has become a site for new residential
